identificationModule.briefTitle: Parkinson's Foundation PD GENEration Genetic Registry
identificationModule.officialTitle: Parkinson's Foundation PD GENEration Genetic Registry

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Development of a central repository for PD-related genomic data for future research.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The purpose of this study is to develop a central repository for PD-related genomic data by individuals who consent to deposit their data and bank their residual DNA obtained through clinical genetic testing for future research use.

bioSpec.description: Isolated DNA from buccal swab or whole blood.

interventions.name: Lab Assay for seven genetic variants for Parkinson's Disease
interventions.description: Counseling provided to participant by site clinician/physician/genetic counselor.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Prevalence of Parkinson's related genetic mutations in an convenience cohort
primaryOutcomes.description: Identify people with Parkinson's who have genetic mutations to advance basic science and clinical research.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Educating people with Parkinson's of their genetic mutation status through genetic testing and counseling
primaryOutcomes.description: People who are informed of their genetic status may be empowered to learn more about their disease and participant in clinical research.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Study Population 1: PWP (open for recruitment)

  1. Meet Movement Disorder Society (MDS) Clinical Diagnostic Criteria for Parkinson's Disease: probable diagnosis.
  2. Willingness to undergo genetic testing, and choose to be informed of genetic testing results for GBA, LRRK2 and 5 additional PD related genes (SNCA, VPS35, PRKN, PINK-1, PARK7).
  3. Capacity to give full informed consent in writing or electronically, and have read and signed the informed consent forms (ICFs) based on site clinician's determination.
  4. Able to perform study activities (including completion of either online, in-person or paper surveys).

Study Population 2: People at risk of developing PD (not open for recruitment)

1. Family members of Study Population 1 may be invited to participate in the study if confirmatory genetic testing is deemed necessary by the genetic testing laboratory.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Diagnosis of an atypical parkinsonian disorder (i.e., multiple system atrophy, progressive supranuclear palsy, dementia with Lewy bodies, corticobasal syndrome), including that due to medications, metabolic disorders, encephalitis, cerebrovascular disease, or normal pressure hydrocephalus.
2. Individuals who have received a blood transfusion within the past 3 months.
3. Individuals who have active hematologic malignancies such as lymphoma or leukemia.
4. Individuals who have had a bone marrow transplant within the past 5 years.
5. Under the age of 18
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Any person with probable diagnosis of Parkinson's disease according to the Movement Disorders Society criteria.

overallOfficials.name: Roy N Alcalay, MS, MD
